Summary Profile: Experience customer service professional. Working with Customer Service and Contact Centers for more than 15 years, from front-line employee to managing large teams of professional colleagues in various locations. Driving many system and process implementation projects, organizational design changes, and migrations/process optimization projects. Passionate about servicing customers, customer satisfaction and the quality of service. "We see our customers as invited guests to a party, and we are the hosts. It's our job every day to make every important aspect of the customer experience a little bit better". Jeff Bezos

Specialties: Customer Service, Call Center, Team Management, B2B business processes, Project Management, Order to Cash, Supply Chain, Transport Management, Organizational changes design and implementation, SAP, Oracle, Change Management, Experience Leasing and Financing Global Operations Services Area Manager - Cisco Capital Cisco Systems February 2013  – Present (2 years 7 months) Kraków Area, Poland Job purpose: Establish new Center of Excellence (COE) team of Leasing and Financing Global Operations Services in the new Krakow Operations Center to drive operational and finance processes and projects to completion to achieve business results. The main area of support provided by this team is in back office process administration such as: Payments, Cash Application, Billing, Order/Returns Entry, Asset tracking, Leasing Contracts Quality reviews, bookings/activations. 
 
Responsibility & achievements: 
•	Recruit and establish new team which is part of Global Operational Services supporting: EMEAR, Canada & Mexico geographies. 
•	Leads and Motivates Center of Excellence teams to achieve desired results & Customer/Partner Satisfaction by implementing effective teamwork & by maintaining appropriate team metrics. 
•	Deliver key milestones in global project, by implementing new system and processes for EMEAR, Canada & Mexico. 
•	Identify and drive various process improvements 
•	Acts as point of escalation for team/customer/field issues. 
•	Influences process automation and cross-functional projects.  
•	Works on highly complex problems requiring judgment in the selection of the method and technique for obtaining a solution. 
•	Reviews/approves supplier payments & intercompany transfers as needed Operational Excellence Manager Shell April 2009  –  January 2013  (3 years 10 months) Kraków Area, Poland Job purpose: Assure the end to end process of Order to Cash performance output and quality on behalf of the customers, and cost-to serve and efficiency on behalf of the business. Driving cost effective, customer-focused experience of the OTC process for the customer. Provide an Customer Service improvement projects, promote world class operational excellence for supported units. Support CSC Manager through root cause analysis on service performance and analysis of the Voice of the Customer. Support of the transition planning and execution of the CSR (Customer Service Relocation) to Krakow by monitoring pre, during and post transition, making sure the quality of the transactions is kept on an expected level. Support CSR local teams in terms of relocation methodology, available tools & expected deliverables for successful migration closure. 
 
Reporting to: Global Operation Excellence & Strategy Lead. Supply Chain Services Manager for Central European region Kimberly-Clark January 2006  –  March 2009  (3 years 3 months) Kraków Area, Poland Job purpose:	To lead, support and develop a team responsible for customer service, transport planning & deployment activities for Central Europe (in both offices: Prague & Klucze). This country focused team aims to meet/exceed customer service targets whilst minimizing freight spend through a coordinated processes. 
Reporting to: European Supply Chain Services Manager 
Budget:	over €5 million in transport, €650k departmental costs 
Achievement:	Standardisation of Customer Service, Transport Planning & Deployment policies & procedures in accordance with KCE's business objectives & CFI's in Central Europe. 
Internal audit achieved at a "well controlled" status for both: Prague & Klucze.	 
Negotiated & signed new contracts with carriers in Poland & Czech Republic. Build strong relationship with existing partners through out difficult period on the transport market during 2006/2007. Local Order to Cash Project Leader - SAP implementation, for CEE region Kimberly-Clark January 2005  –  December 2005  (1 year) Prague, The Capital, Czech Republic Job purpose:	To deliver new business processes according to the business blueprint, a comprehensively tested SAP R/3 system including the required user training and documentation and also a new organizational design for C&EE region, stating in which location business functions will be performed to fit the newly implemented processes while satisfying Customer Management needs and the requirement to drive costs down as much as possible. 
 
 
Reporting to:	ESPRIT Project Manager  
Budget:	Indirect budget responsibility of €6 million  
Achievement:	Full programme management for design, build, test and implementation of R3 system, through out various project phases. For Operations, Purchasing & Accounting.  
Project delivered on time and below budget. 
Successful "Go-Live" managed in 3 different office locations & 8 Regional Distribution Canters & Mills. Customer Service & Operations Manager CE, KC Professional Kimberly-Clark March 2002  –  January 2005  (2 years 11 months) Prague, The Capital, Czech Republic Job purpose:	Manage Order to Delivery process within Central Europe for KC Professional. Ensure relevant customer knowledge, relationship and communication to deliver required customer service levels.  
 
Reporting to:	KC Professional Sales Manager - Central Europe. 
Budget:	Indirect budget responsibility €50k;  
 
Achievement:	Creation and implementation of customer service operational procedures according to Corporate Financial Instructions. 
Establishment and control of Key Performance Indicators within KCP customer service.  
Shut down of the Distribution Center in Poland, switch polish customers into direct deliveries ex mills. 
Promoted to Order to Cash Project Leader. Customer Service Specialist, KC Professional, Kimberly-Clark January 2001  –  February 2002  (1 year 2 months) Warsaw, Masovian District, Poland Job purpose:	Supporting operational activities with local logistics provider, sales forecasting, order processing, supporting sales promotional activities, sales reporting. 
 
Reporting to:	Logistics Manager C&EE. 
Achievement:	Successful implementation of Intreim/R3 system in Poland	 
Internal audit achievement as "well controlled". Reporting to:	Customer Service Manager Poland. 
Achievement:	Successful implementation of new Sales and Distribution system. Summary Successful 20+ years career working with global clients, teams and partners in creating vision, identifying opportunities, jump starting new business ideas, building organizations and delivering strong revenues/profits within intensely competitive markets across diverse industries. Strength in anticipating industry needs, market trends, transforming/optimizing business operations, and establishing effective teams to drive continued growth, improve market positioning, and strengthen bottom-line financial performance. Extensive experience in all aspects of product life cycle, from initial needs assessments through development, launch and support to ongoing operations. Cross-functional expertise in strategic planning and competitive positioning of products and services. 
 
Hands on experience in managing critical customer accounts with high business impact and volume with special emphasis on proactive prevention of customer escalations/product systemic issues, by implementing the learning’s from the past engagements/escalations optimizing processes, lower costs and improving customer services.
